climbs.name: Sketch Slab
climbs.fa: Peter, Lisa, Ian, Old School maybe

content.description: Climb up from a sit the slab just right of the right arete (Summer Lovin') of the Rampart Roof boulder.  a little forced to not trend right in easier territory, but good moves, and exciting.
content.protection: a few pads and a good spot.  There is a drop off into the talus that would suck to go off.
content.location: Just below the route Michael's Project in the Talus.

content.description:
Start low in middle of boulder and work your way up and out roof to good holds at the lip.  Two variations exist.  

  Wow, this boulder is impressive!  It sits about 50ft down the talus from Many Pines Buttress and sticks out like a sore thumb.  It's huge and has a beautiful roof with lots of features.
content.protection: Bring all the pads, and have your best spotters.
content.location: Hike to Many Pines Buttress along the rampart.  From Callipigeanous and Michael's hike down into talus for approx: 50ft.  You can't miss it.

content.description: Start in the Center of the downhill facing overhanging face and go right around the arete and topout on the slab.  The safety line on the boulder.
content.protection: a few pads, might get away with 2 if you don't fall at the end.
content.location: On the Rampart Roof boulder, just below the route Michael's Project on the East Bluff.  Easiest to drop in from the route.

content.description: On the rampart roof boulder.  On the left of the downhill facing side and do a tricky sequence to a good hold and trend left on jugs above a boulder and mantel it out.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter to shuffle a pad.
content.location: Just below the route Michael's Project in the Talus field.

climbs.name: Brave Heart
climbs.fa: Ian CB, Peter B or Old School

content.description: Climb directly up the left arete of the downhill side of the Rampart Roof Boulder.  This is a cool and exposed feeling climb with the hard moves at the top.
content.protection: Several Pads and a good spot. The top is a little tricky.
content.location: Just below the route Michael's project.

content.description: A prominent pedestal at the top of the boulder field.
